title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) — In a battle of titans, the Houston Rockets leaned on the most dominant force in the game, riding a historic, Herculean effort from Hakeem Olajuwon to a 102-94 victory over the Vancouver Grizzlies.

From the opening tip, this was The Dream’s show. Olajuwon was simply unguardable, putting on a masterclass in the low post. He poured in a staggering **42 points**, slicing through double-teams and finishing with his signature array of dizzying spin moves and feathery-soft touch. His performance was not merely scoring; it was a complete demolition. He corralled **17 rebounds** and protected the rim with **6 blocked shots**, anchoring the Rockets at both ends of the floor.

While Olajuwon authored the masterpiece, he received crucial support. Clyde Drexler provided the backcourt punch with **23 points**, and Charles Barkley battled inside for a **12-point, 13-rebound** double-double, forming a formidable trio that Vancouver simply could not counter.

The Grizzlies, led by Byron Scott’s **20 points** and a strong **17-point, 10-assist** double-double from point guard Greg Anthony, fought valiantly. They stayed within striking distance for much of the contest, but every time they threatened a run, Olajuwon had an answer—a thunderous dunk, a put-back, or a swatted shot that silenced the threat.

In the end, the narrative was singular and undeniable. On this night, the Rockets had Hakeem Olajuwon, and the Grizzlies did not. His 42-point tour de force was more than enough to power Houston to a hard-fought win, another legendary entry in the ledger of one of the game’s all-time greats.
